result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Quinton Evans Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Current with any other sentence. Credit for 73 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Plasma Care Center at 2522 W. State St., Milwaukee, WI.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming. Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Undergo random urine screens.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court waived DNA surcharge as one is already on file. Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of inmate funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court waived DNA surcharge as one is already on file.  Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of inmate funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Return of premature petition for sentence adjustment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box 36 Winnebago WI 54985.

It is ordered that the DOC will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date, filed and signed by the Court.
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to  Br. 26, Judge Pocan, for review.  jm
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 26, Judge Pocan.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (16 pages) commencing on 06-20-2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING received and filed.
Also referenced ATN #41004537758099, arrest date 4-9-14, MCSO.

Defendant Eric Quinton Evans in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Eric Quinton Evans in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 4 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 2 YEAR with credit for 73 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 2 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court waived DNA surcharge as one is already on file.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of inmate funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
- AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- No contact with Plasma Care Center at 2522 W. State St., Milwaukee, WI.
- Court set restitution at zero.
FILED:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Eric Quinton Evans not in court, in custody MSDF.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Eric Quinton Evans not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel awaiting all discovery.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Quinton Evans in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Eric Quinton Evans in custody.  Thomas Potter for Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Grifols Plasma Center located at 2522 W. State St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Eric Quinton Evans in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Eric Quinton Evans in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
